page.title: 09GHOSTS AND GOTHIC-SPETCHLEY
page.content: {Pugin}- architect of the Gothic revival (1812-1852), designed the former St Anne's Catholic Primary School, in 1841, which is opposite the hall. Sir Edward Elgar(1857-1934), was once a pupil.Here{Elgar}is said to have listened to the wind in the pines and heard the theme of his{ {'Dream of Gerontius' { {Supernatural}-Over the A422 is an ornate iron footbridge where the ghost of Lady Katharine Berkeley is said to walk in white robes, singing as she goes. She is said to haunt the old rectory cottage, known locally as 'the priest house'. Formerly, chaplains to the Berkeley family lived here. The present occupants of the cottage however, have not seen her!
